definitions.definition: The ship occupied by the fleet 's commander (usually an admiral ); it denotes this by flying his flag .
The ship regarded as most important out of a group, e.g. a nation's navy or company's fleet.
The most important one out of a related group.
examples: The retail company's store in London is their flagship .

main_definition: ( nautical , military ) The ship occupied by the fleet 's commander (usually an admiral ); it denotes this by flying his flag .
secondary_definitions: ( nautical ) The ship regarded as most important out of a group, e.g. a nation's navy or company's fleet.
( by extension , often attributive ) The most important one out of a related group.
